title: Firefox crashes M2 Air whilst in sleep mode OS Sonoma 14.7.2
content:
I have used Firefox for more years than I care to remember, but at the moment I'm forced to use Safari, which is OK but missing several vital features for me like translating Greek web pages!

The problem I have is this:- Whenever My M2 macbook Air running Sonoma 14.7.2 goes to sleep and wake it the screen is flickering and needs a hard restart. After lots of trial and error it appears to be something to do with Firefox version 133.0.3 (aarch64) as it only happens when I leave Firefox running.

I have run the Apple offline diagnostics multiple times immediately after the crash but I never get any reported errors. Interestingly I get no dialog from Apple that my Mac has crashed or needed to be restarted

I have restarted my Mac into safe mode, same problem

I have refreshed Firefox several times, same problem

Any help woulld be much appreciated!

Happy Christmas and a peaceful New Year to you all

Thank you, Peter
creator: pd.thomas

title: Cannot update Firefox - version 113 is now acting very strange
content: Using Linux Mint 19 Cinnamon version 3.8.9 and stuck on Firefox 113.0.2 which will not update. Have found the command DisableAppUpdate but cannot override the setting. How can I possibly update this to the latest version as the release I have is now behaving quite weird. Thank you.

title: Removing rounded corners of the firefox window on MacOS
content:
Hello there,

During my quest of trying to get macOS and apps to look more like I want, I haven't found any answer online on how to modify the rounding of Firefox corners to be square. I have also heard that Firefox has a known bug of not respecting system appearance, so I have decided not to mess around with important system files. So my question is: What would be your recommended way to square the window corners for macOS?

title: Firefox Dev Tools doesn't show css changes after closing and re-opening dev tools
content:
Steps to recreate:

  1. Open any website
  2. Make any css changes. These will be shown in the Changes tab in the dev tools
  3. Close dev tools, then re-open. Now those changes won't be shown

Sometimes I need to close dev tools in order to see how the web page would look normally.
